data.title: Sailing Until the Ship Sinks
data.meta_description: Author Savyon Liebrecht Says She Leaves the Endings of Her Stories Open, So as Not to Impose Pessimistic Endings on the Optimistic Reader. Her Latest Collection of Stories Is About to Hit Local Bookstores
data.text:
A month-and-a-half ago, the well-known Italian director Ettore Scola arrived in Israel for a visit. From Jerusalem, he called the home of writer Savyon Liebrecht in Holon and asked to meet her. "He took a taxi and came from Jerusalem with a bouquet of flowers," says Liebrecht. "It turned out that he's read some of my books, and he reminded me of a scene from my book `A Man and a Woman and a Man,' which I had forgotten. After he left, I picked up the book and found that there really is a scene in it in which the two lovers go to the movies and see one of Scola's films."
